- The World Health Organization emphasizes the importance of local voices and data in enhancing malaria elimination efforts across Africa.
- Engaging local communities in malaria prevention and treatment strategies can lead to more effective and sustainable outcomes.
- The article highlights successful case studies where localized approaches have significantly reduced malaria cases.
- It calls for increased investment in local health systems and data collection to tailor interventions to specific regional needs.
- Strengthening local capacities is crucial for achieving the global goal of malaria elimination by 2030.
